Package controller

Class ValidateMap

java.lang.Object
controller.ValidateMap
public class ValidateMap extends Object
This class checks the validity of the map by converting into a graph object.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ValidateMap(int p_VertexCount)
    This constructor of a class initialize the adjacency list representation of graph.
    ValidateMap(ArrayList<Country> p_CountryObjects, ArrayList<Continent> p_ContinentObjects)
    This constructor receives country and continent objects and use them to add into adjacency list of graph.

  • Constructor Details

    • ValidateMap

      public ValidateMap(int p_VertexCount)
      This constructor of a class initialize the adjacency list representation of graph.
      Parameters:
      p_VertexCount - This is the size of which adjacency list will be created.

    • ValidateMap

      public ValidateMap(ArrayList<Country> p_CountryObjects, ArrayList<Continent> p_ContinentObjects) throws Exception
      This constructor receives country and continent objects and use them to add into adjacency list of graph.
      Parameters:
      p_CountryObjects - List of country objects stored in the map model.
      p_ContinentObjects - List of continent objects stored in the map model.
      Throws:
      Exception - If any continent doesn't have a country, it notifies the user.

  • Method Details

    • checkCountryAndContinent

      public boolean checkCountryAndContinent(ArrayList<Country> p_CountryObjects, @NotNull @NotNull ArrayList<Continent> p_ContinentObjects)
      This method checks if every continent has at least one country
      Parameters:
      p_CountryObjects - List of country objects
      p_ContinentObjects - List of continent objects
      Returns:
      true if all continents have at least one country. false otherwise.

    • updateCount

      public HashMap<Integer,ArrayList<Integer>> updateCount(ArrayList<Country> p_CountryObjects)
      This method takes the arraylist of country objects and creates a new hashmap which is then returned to validation method All the updation in countryid and their respective borders after addition/removal is taken care for the sake of validation.
      Parameters:
      p_CountryObjects - List of country objects
      Returns:
      d_UpdatedMap Hashmap which contains the updated ID and their respective borders of each country

    • assignBorders

      public void assignBorders(HashMap<Integer,ArrayList<Integer>> p_HMap)
      This method fill all the values in the adjacency graph representation (i.e. d_VertexList).
      Parameters:
      p_HMap - This parameter is the updated hash map created in updateCount method

    • addBorder

      public void addBorder(int p_U, int p_V)
      This method add the border 'p_V' at the index position 'p_U'
      Parameters:
      p_U - index of the arraylist where border has to be added.
      p_V - value to be added in the arraylist

    • runDFS

      public boolean runDFS(int p_Start)
      This method returns true if graph is connected. DFS starts from one index and try to reach every other index from there. This is checked for all the index present in the graph.
      Parameters:
      p_Start - starting point of the DFS traversal.
      Returns:
      returns true if all countries are traversed from the starting point. false otherwise.

    • getTranspose

      public ValidateMap getTranspose(ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> p_VertexList)
      This method takes the transpose of the graph. For Example : If there is a border between country 1 to 2, it will become 2 to 1
      Parameters:
      p_VertexList - list of vertices in the graph. (list of countries and their borders)
      Returns:
      new validate map object which holds the transposed vertex list.

    • isValid

      public String isValid()
      This method calls DFS for original graph and transposed graph.
      Returns:
      String "Map is Valid" if dfs is passed else "Map is not Valid"

    • checkContinentIsConnectedSubgraph

      public void checkContinentIsConnectedSubgraph(ArrayList<Continent> p_ContinentObjects) throws Exception
      This method takes list of continents as a parameter and check if all the countries within that continent is internally connected.
      Parameters:
      p_ContinentObjects - List of continents objects
      Throws:
      Exception - throws custom exception when all countries within particular continent are not connected.
